item.title: How to change “No match found!” on your no-code Q&A bot
item.description: Last week, I blogged about building a no-code Q&A bot for your website. One little niggle I had with the bot was the response when it could match a user input to a Q&A. I wondered how to change “No match found!”. I looked around the qnamaker.ai site and couldn’t find a place I could change this. I submitted some feedback and the great people at the other of the Q&A site responded super quickly.

item.title: Easy-peasy Q&A bot
item.description: Everyone seems to have a live chat option for their site but I’m frequently away, so I wanted something that people could talk to interactively. This is a perfect scenario for a Q&A bot. Microsoft takes a ton of the pain out of Q&A bots, and it was much easier than I thought to get it added to my WordPress blog. Here is a how to do it for your site.
